main event: Pilots from two F-86D aircraft observed a bright object larger than a star near Noshiro-Machi, Japan, on July 29, 1950.
interesting points: The object exhibited illuminating colors that changed and flickered, appearing to dim and then brighten every 3-4 seconds,The object was seen while the aircraft was operating a routine patrol at an altitude of 15,000 feet,Two pilots confirmed the sighting while the weather was clear,Astro charts indicated Mars was in the area at the time but could not confirm it as the observed object,The pilots lost altitude during the observation while the object maintained its position.
sighted object: a large, bright object with changing colors
